questions.question: Evaluate the definite integral \(\int_0^3 x\sqrt{x^2+7}\,dx\).
Evaluate \(\int_0^{\pi/3} \sin^2 x\cos x\,dx\).
questions.explanation: Let \(u=\sin x\), \(du=\cos x\,dx\). When \(x=0\), \(u=0\); when \(x=\pi/3\), \(u=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{2}\). Integral \(=\int_0^{\sqrt{3}/2}u^2\,du=\frac{u^3}{3}\big|_0^{\sqrt{3}/2}=\frac{1}{3}\cdot\frac{3\sqrt{3}}{8}=\frac{\sqrt{3}}{8}\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_1^{e^2} \frac{\ln x}{x}\,dx\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-7t+12\) m/s. On the interval \([0,6]\), how many times does the particle change direction?
questions.explanation: Set \(v(t)=0\): \((t-3)(t-4)=0\) ⇒ \(t=3,4\). Check signs: \(v(0)=12>0\), \(v(3.5)=-0.25<0\), \(v(6)=6>0\). The particle changes direction at \(t=3\) and \(t=4\), so 2 times.

questions.question: Find the average value of \(f(x)=6x^2\) on the interval \([0,2]\).
Let \(h(x)=x^3-x-5\). Which interval is guaranteed by the Intermediate Value Theorem to contain a zero?
questions.explanation: IVT requires a sign change. \(h(1)=1-1-5=-5<0\) and \(h(2)=8-2-5=1>0\). Since \(h\) is continuous and changes sign on \([1,2]\), there is a zero in this interval.

questions.question: Find the general solution to the differential equation \(\frac{dy}{dx}=\frac{4x}{y}\).
Let \(F(x)=\int_3^{x^4}\sqrt{t^2+1}\,dt\). Find \(F'(x)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC Part 1 and chain rule: \(F'(x)=\sqrt{(x^4)^2+1}\cdot\frac{d}{dx}(x^4)=4x^3\sqrt{x^8+1}\).

questions.question: Differentiate \(f(x)=e^{\tan x}\).
Find \(f'(x)\) if \(f(x)=\sec(5x)\).
Let \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2+2 & x<3\\k & x=3\\4x-1 & x>3\end{cases}\). What value of \(k\) makes \(f\) continuous at \(x=3\)?
questions.explanation: Left limit: \(3^2+2=11\). Right limit: \(4(3)-1=11\). Both equal 11, so \(k=f(3)=11\).

questions.question: Find all x‑values where \(f(x)=x^4-6x^2+1\) has a point of inflection.
questions.explanation: \(f''(x)=12x^2-12=12(x-1)(x+1)\). Zeros at \(x=\pm1\). \(f''\) changes sign at both, so inflection points are at \(x=\pm1\).

questions.question: Use implicit differentiation to find \(\frac{dy}{dx}\) for \(x^3+y^3=6xy\).
Find the equation of the normal line to \(y=x^3\) at the point \((2,8)\).
questions.explanation: \(y'=3x^2\). At \(x=2\): tangent slope \(=12\). Normal slope \(=-\frac{1}{12}\). Equation: \(y-8=-\frac{1}{12}(x-2)\).

questions.question: Let \(f(x)=\frac{3x}{x^2+4}\). Find the instantaneous rate of change of \(f\) at \(x=1\).
If \(g(2)=7\) and \(g(6)=19\), find \(\int_2^6 g'(x)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: By the Fundamental Theorem of Calculus: \(\int_2^6 g'(x)\,dx=g(6)-g(2)=19-7=12\).

questions.question: For \(f(x)=x^2-8x+3\) on \([0,6]\), find the value of \(c\) in \((0,6)\) guaranteed by the Mean Value Theorem.
Differentiate \(f(x)=\frac{e^x}{x^2+1}\).
A particle has velocity \(v(t)=3t^2-18t+15\) ft/s on \([0,7]\). Find the minimum value of the velocity on this interval.
Determine the intervals on which \(f(x)=x^3-12x+5\) is decreasing.
Which of the following functions is NOT differentiable at \(x=3\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(x)=(x-3)^{2/3}\) has a cusp at \(x=3\) since \(f'(x)=\frac{2}{3}(x-3)^{-1/3}\to\infty\) as \(x\to3\). The other three functions are smooth and differentiable at \(x=3\).

questions.question: Sand flows into a bin at a rate of \(r(t)=4t+5\) cubic feet per minute. How many cubic feet accumulate from \(t=0\) to \(t=5\) minutes?

The derivative \(f'(x)\) changes from positive to negative at \(x=-3\), from negative to positive at \(x=2\), and equals zero at \(x=5\) with \(f'\) positive on both sides. Classify each critical point.
options: Max at \(-3\), min at \(2\), neither at \(5\)
Min at \(-3\), max at \(2\), neither at \(5\)
Max at \(-3\), min at \(2\), min at \(5\)
Min at \(-3\), max at \(2\), max at \(5\)
questions.explanation: First Derivative Test: + to − ⇒ max at \(x=-3\); − to + ⇒ min at \(x=2\); no sign change (positive on both sides) ⇒ neither at \(x=5\).

questions.question: Find the area under the curve \(y=\sqrt{x}\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=9\).
At \(x=a\), a function satisfies \(f(a)>0\), \(f'(a)>0\), and \(f''(a)<0\). Which description best matches the behavior near \(x=a\)?
questions.explanation: \(f(a)>0\) means above x‑axis; \(f'(a)>0\) means increasing; \(f''(a)<0\) means concave down.

questions.question: Evaluate \(\int_{-3}^{3}(2x^5+4x^3-6x+9)\,dx\).
questions.explanation: All odd-power terms (\(2x^5\), \(4x^3\), \(-6x\)) integrate to zero on \([-3,3]\). Only the constant survives: \(\int_{-3}^{3}9\,dx=9(6)=54\).

questions.question: Find the area of the region enclosed by \(y=x^2\) and \(y=2x+3\).
For \(f(x)=\ln(x^2+4)\), determine the interval(s) on which \(f\) is concave down.
Find the equation of the tangent line to \(f(x)=\ln(4x+1)\) at \(x=2\).
The area of a circle is increasing at \(10\pi\) cm²/s. At what rate is the radius increasing when the radius is 5 cm?
questions.explanation: \(A=\pi r^2\), so \(\frac{dA}{dt}=2\pi r\frac{dr}{dt}\). With \(\frac{dA}{dt}=10\pi\) and \(r=5\): \(10\pi=2\pi(5)\frac{dr}{dt}\) ⇒ \(\frac{dr}{dt}=1\) cm/s.

questions.question: A substance decays according to \(P(t)=200e^{-0.1t}\). How much remains after 20 years?
Find all relative extrema of \(f(x)=2x^3-3x^2-36x+10\) using the First Derivative Test.
options: Relative maximum at \(x=-2\), relative minimum at \(x=3\)
Relative minimum at \(x=-2\), relative maximum at \(x=3\)
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=6x^2-6x-36=6(x-3)(x+2)\). Critical: \(x=-2,3\). Sign: \(f'>0\) for \(x<-2\), \(f'<0\) for \(-2<x<3\), \(f'>0\) for \(x>3\). So: relative maximum at \(x=-2\) (+→−) and relative minimum at \(x=3\) (−→+).

questions.question: Find the value of \(k\) that makes \(f(x)=\begin{cases}x^2-5&x<4\\kx-1&x\ge4\end{cases}\) continuous at \(x=4\).
Use the Trapezoidal Rule with \(n=4\) to approximate \(\int_1^3\frac{1}{x}\,dx\).
Find the critical points of \(f(x)=2\cos x-\cos(2x)\) on \([0,\pi]\).
questions.explanation: \(f'(x)=-2\sin x+2\sin(2x)=2\sin x(2\cos x-1)\). Set to zero: \(\sin x=0\Rightarrow x=0,\pi\); or \(2\cos x-1=0\Rightarrow\cos x=\tfrac{1}{2}\Rightarrow x=\tfrac{\pi}{3}\). Critical points on \([0,\pi]\): \(x=0,\tfrac{\pi}{3},\pi\).

questions.question: The base of a solid is the region bounded by \(y=\sqrt{x}\) and \(y=0\) from \(x=0\) to \(x=9\). Cross sections perpendicular to the x‑axis are squares. Find the volume.
At what x‑values on \(y=x^3\) is the tangent line perpendicular to \(y=-\frac{1}{12}x+5\)?
questions.explanation: Slope of given line = \(-\tfrac{1}{12}\). Perpendicular slope = \(12\). Set \(y'=3x^2=12\) ⇒ \(x^2=4\) ⇒ \(x=\pm2\).

questions.question: Is \(f(x)=|2x-6|\) differentiable at \(x=3\)?
options: No, because the left and right derivatives are \(-2\) and \(2\) respectively
Yes, because the function is continuous at \(x=3\)
No, because the function is not defined at \(x=3\)
questions.explanation: For \(x<3\): \(f(x)=6-2x\), left derivative \(=-2\). For \(x>3\): \(f(x)=2x-6\), right derivative \(=2\). Since \(-2\ne2\), \(f\) is not differentiable at \(x=3\).

questions.question: Let \(B(x)=\int_0^{x^3}\sin(t)\,dt\). Evaluate \(B'\!\left(\sqrt[3]{\pi}\right)\).
questions.explanation: By FTC and chain rule: \(B'(x)=\sin(x^3)\cdot3x^2\). At \(x=\sqrt[3]{\pi}\): \(x^3=\pi\), so \(B'(\sqrt[3]{\pi})=\sin(\pi)\cdot3(\sqrt[3]{\pi})^2=0\cdot3\pi^{2/3}=0\).

questions.question: Evaluate \(\lim_{x\to0}\frac{\sin(5x)-5x}{x^3}\).
questions.explanation: Applying L'Hôpital's Rule three times (0/0 each time): \(\frac{5\cos5x-5}{3x^2}\to\frac{-25\sin5x}{6x}\to\frac{-125\cos5x}{6}\to\frac{-125}{6}\) as \(x\to0\).

questions.question: A farmer fences a rectangular field along a river using 120 m of fencing for three sides (no fence along the river). What dimensions maximize the enclosed area?
questions.explanation: Let \(x\) = each side perpendicular to river, \(y\) = side parallel. Constraint: \(2x+y=120\Rightarrow y=120-2x\). Area \(A=xy=120x-2x^2\). \(A'=120-4x=0\Rightarrow x=30\), \(y=60\). Max area = \(1800\) m².

questions.question: Use the Second Derivative Test to classify the critical points of \(f(x)=x^3+3x^2-9x+2\).
options: Relative maximum at \(x=-3\), relative minimum at \(x=1\)
Relative minimum at \(x=-3\), relative maximum at \(x=1\)
Relative maximum at \(x=1\), relative minimum at \(x=-3\)

questions.question: Use a left Riemann sum with \(n=4\) equal subintervals to approximate \(\int_1^3(2x^2-1)\,dx\).
Find \(\frac{d}{dx}[\arccos(3x)]\).
A particle has position \(s(t)=2t^3-9t^2+12t-4\). Find the acceleration at each moment when the velocity is zero.
Find the absolute maximum and minimum values of \(f(x)=x^4-2x^2+3\) on \([-2,2]\).
options: Abs max 11 at \(x=\pm2\); abs min 2 at \(x=\pm1\)
Abs max 11 at \(x=\pm2\); abs min 3 at \(x=0\)
Abs max 3 at \(x=0\); abs min 2 at \(x=\pm1\)
Abs max 11 at \(x=2\); abs min 2 at \(x=1\)

questions.question: Solve the initial value problem \(\frac{dy}{dx}=x\sqrt{y}\), \(y(0)=9\).
A particle moves with velocity \(v(t)=t^2-4\) ft/s on \([0,4]\). Find the total distance traveled.
Differentiate \(f(x)=(5x^3-2x)^6\).
Use linear approximation at \(x=27\) to estimate \(\sqrt[3]{27.9}\).
